Here are seven popular yoga exercises that can help improve flexibility, strength, balance, and overall well-being:
Downward Facing Dog (Adho Mukha Svanasana): This pose stretches the hamstrings, calves, and spine while strengthening the arms, shoulders, and wrists. It also improves circulation and can help relieve stress and anxiety.
Warrior II (Virabhadrasana II): This pose strengthens the legs, hips, and core while improving balance and concentration. It can also help open the chest and lungs, and stretch the shoulders and arms.
Tree Pose (Vrikshasana): This balancing pose strengthens the legs and core while improving balance and focus. It can also help stretch the hips, groin, and thighs.
Triangle Pose (Trikonasana): This pose stretches the hamstrings, hips, and spine while strengthening the legs, ankles, and core. It can also help improve digestion and relieve stress and anxiety.
Bridge Pose (Setu Bandha Sarvangasana): This pose strengthens the back, glutes, and legs while stretching the chest, neck, and spine. It can also help improve circulation and relieve stress and mild depression.
Child's Pose (Balasana): This relaxing pose stretches the hips, thighs, and ankles while gently releasing tension in the back, neck, and shoulders. It can also help calm the mind and promote relaxation.
Cobra Pose (Bhujangasana): This pose strengthens the back, arms, and shoulders while stretching the chest and spine. It can also help improve posture and relieve stress and fatigue.
